thread.title: Butcher Ryan Watson talks babies, butchering and beef
thread.title_full: Butcher Ryan Watson talks babies, butchering and beef | News Local

author: Ryan Watson
title: Butcher Ryan Watson talks babies, butchering and beef
text:
The Fairlight Butcher, aka Ryan Watson. Picture: Troy Snook Manly ‘Throwing around sides of beef and handling a baby will be a contrast!’ Ryan Watson, 21, 2017 5:14pm 'I've delivered 4000 babies, but didn't deliver my own!' Steve Flood: 'I'll take my time to find the right girl!'
ON MY second day as owner at The Fairlight Butcher, my wife Roslynne came up to the shop to tell me she was pregnant.
The business stress suddenly rose! But whenever there was stress the baby was a distraction and vice versa. I’d use it as motivation to get things up and running.
Roz is 38 weeks pregnant now, and we don’t know what we’re having — it’s going to be a surprise.
We’ve got all of the baby stuff. It’s like when you get married and you go, “Right, we’ve got to book the photographer, the venue ...” and you do all it in one go.
We did that with the baby — we’ve got the pram, the car seat ...
media_camera Ryan Watson took over the shop in July. Picture: Troy Snook
Soon after we found out about the pregnancy, we had to move house, so in six months we bought a business, got pregnant and moved house. It was big!
On Sunday we did a tour of the hospital and birthing suite at Royal North Shore where Roz works.
We did our anti-natal classes in Bondi with two sisters — one’s a yoga instructor and one’s a midwife. There were only two other couples in the group. It was cool and definitely a learning curve.
The lady went round the class and for a bit of a joke I said, “It’s a bit like wrapping up some snags in butcher’s paper” and I wrapped the doll up like that!
Thanks @johcoh05 for sharing. Great spit roasted whole lamb from Cowra to celebrate Australia Day from @thefairlightbutcher #regram #cowralamb #spitroastlamb #australiaday2017 #bbq #food #meat #fairlight #manlybeach
